I guess the Eigen and Compute0 thread pools are controlled by the inter and intra configs.
the "graph_runner" are created by this constructor GraphRunner::GraphRunner(Env* env). However, I'm not sure where these methods is called. Does anyone have an idea? Thanks.

body:
I was able to log the name of the thread pools:

> name: Eigen num_threads: 1
> name: Compute0 num_threads: 1
> name: graph_runner num_threads: 1
> name: graph_runner num_threads: 1
> name: graph_runner num_threads: 1
> name: graph_runner num_threads: 1
> name: graph_runner num_threads: 1
> name: graph_runner num_threads: 1
> name: graph_runner num_threads: 1
> name: graph_runner num_threads: 1
> name: graph_runner num_threads: 1
> name: graph_runner num_threads: 1

I guess the `Eigen` and `Compute0` thread pools are controlled by the inter and intra configs. 
the "graph_runner" are created by this constructor `GraphRunner::GraphRunner(Env* env)`. However, I'm not sure where these methods is called.  Does anyone have an idea? Thanks.
